com.sap.spe.pricing.transactiondata

Interface IPricingDocument

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPricingDocumentCommon

    public interface IPricingDocument
extends IPricingDocumentCommon
    The pricing document contains accumulated pricing information of all pricing items and provides methods which are processing all pricing items.

    • Method Detail

      • createItem

        IPricingItem createItem(IItemBase item)
        Creates a new PricingItem with the item number of the input parameter item and adds it to my set of PricingItems. Typical use: When a new sales document line item is created. Note: The position is necessary to store the PricingConditions for one PricingItem.
        Parameters:
        item - - The pricing relevant part of a (sales order) line item. (The corresponding interface should be implemented by the line item of the document.)

      • pricing

        void pricing()
        Call the method pricing for each of my pricing items.

      • pricing

        void pricing(IPricingItem[] pricingItems)
        Call the method pricing for each of the pricing items in the array of pricingItems.

      • pricingComplete

        void pricingComplete()
        Starts pricing logic for the whole pricing document (e.g. the group condition logic: here the accumulation of scale base values for groups of items is done).

      • addItem

        void addItem(IPricingItem item)
        Adds a PricingItem to my set of PricingItems and performs pricing. Typical use: When a sales document item is created.

      • addItems

        void addItems(IPricingItem[] items)
        Adds PricingItems to my set of PricingItems and performs pricing. Typical use: When a new sales document items are created. Note: * The position is necessary to store the PricingConditions for one PricingItem. Futhermore the method pricingComplete is processed.

      • addItemWithoutPricing

        void addItemWithoutPricing(IPricingItem item)
        Adds a PricingItem to my set of PricingItems. Typical use: When a sales document item is loaded from the local db or from external.

      • removeItem

        boolean removeItem(java.lang.String itemNumber)
        Removes a PricingItem with an itemnumber from my set of PricingItems.
        Returns:
        true if the element was found, else false. Typical use: When a sales document item is deleted.

      • removeItems

        boolean removeItems(java.lang.String[] itemNumbers)
        Removes PricingItems from my set of PricingItems. (Only removes the first occurrence.)
        Returns:
        true if all elements were found, else false. Typical use: When sales order items are deleted. Note: * Futhermore the method pricingComplete is processed.

      • findItem

        IPricingItem findItem(java.lang.String itemNumber)
        Returns:
        an item in my list whose item number matches itemNumber. Returns null if nothing matched.

      • findItemExternalNumber

        IPricingItem findItemExternalNumber(java.lang.String externalItemNumber)
        Returns:
        an item in my list whose external item number matches externalItemNumber. Returns null if nothing matched.

      • determineRelevantAttributes

        IRelevantAttributes determineRelevantAttributes()
        Returns a list of all attributes which are relevant for the search of condition records (e.g. VKORG, VTWEG, MATNR....). These are determined from all AccessSequences used in my PricingProcedure. The sales document should be responsible for only adding the relevant fields to the PricingItem. Typical use: This method should be called when the sales document is created and the Procedure for the document is known. The contents of the attributes should be filled by the sales order item and this completed OrderedSet should then be passed by the method AddAttributes.

      • getDocumentCurrencyUnit

        ICurrencyUnit getDocumentCurrencyUnit()
        Specified by:
        getDocumentCurrencyUnit in interface IPricingDocumentCommon
        Returns:
        my document currency unit.

      • setDocumentCurrencyUnit

        void setDocumentCurrencyUnit(ICurrencyUnit documentCurrencyUnit)
        Set my document currency unit.

      • setUnitToBeRoundedTo

        void setUnitToBeRoundedTo(int unitToBeRoundedTo)
        Sets the unit to be rounded, e.g. 5 for the so-called 5-Rappen-rounding in swisse. Should be 0 if no rounding should be performed.

      • setLocalCurrencyUnit

        void setLocalCurrencyUnit(ICurrencyUnit localCurrencyUnit)
        Set my local currency unit.

      • setPerformTrace

        void setPerformTrace(boolean performTrace)

      • addHeaderCondition

        IHeaderCondition addHeaderCondition(java.lang.String condTypeName,
                                    java.math.BigDecimal condRate,
                                    java.lang.String unitName,
                                    java.math.BigDecimal prUnitValue,
                                    java.lang.String prUnitName,
                                    char calcType)
                             throws ManualChangeNotAllowedException,
                                    ConversionMissingDataException
        This method was created for SAP Note 1294785.
        Parameters:
        condTypeName - The name of the condition type.
        condRate - The Condition Rate.
        unitName - The Condition Currency.
        prUnitValue - The Condition Pricing Unit.
        prUnitName - The Condition Unit.
        calcType - The calculation type.
        Returns:
        A list of IHeaderCondition.
        Throws:
        ManualChangeNotAllowedException
        ConversionMissingDataException

      • setAlwaysPerformingCalculation

        void setAlwaysPerformingCalculation(boolean b)
        For performance reasons, the automatic calculation might be deactivated. After having done a series of method calls, the calculation must be triggered explicitely.
        Parameters:
        b -

      • calculate

        void calculate()
        An explicit calculation might be triggered e.g. after switching on the alwaysPerformingCalculation flag.

      • getHdrLevelPricingCompletionStatus

        boolean getHdrLevelPricingCompletionStatus()
        get header level pricing status. It returns true if pricing at header level is already done otherwise return false.
        Returns:
        header level pricing completion status.
